basics.name: Chris Magistrado
basics.label: Cybersecurity SME, Founder, Investor
basics.summary: Cybersecurity expert with over 10 years in vulnerability research, now leading TopCleared Recruiting and hosting Hackers to Founders podcast.

work.name: Hackers to Founders
work.summary: Hosts interviews with cybersecurity professionals turned entrepreneurs, bridging cybersecurity and business innovation.
highlights: Featured top-tier cybersecurity and tech talent
Engaged diverse audiences in cybersecurity trends and challenges

work.name: TopCleared Recruiting
work.summary: Recruiting agency for cleared cybersecurity and STEM professionals, focused on filling high-demand, mission-critical roles.
highlights: Placed top talent in cybersecurity roles for government and private sectors
Specialization in TS/SCI + Full Scope Poly cleared positions

work.name: Capital Hire
work.summary: Supports tech entrepreneurs through strategic advice and funding.
highlights: Guided startups in cybersecurity and tech

work.name: RedBlue Security
work.summary: Cybersecurity recruiting firm specializing in technical roles across the cybersecurity industry.
highlights: Placed talent in roles like Vulnerability Researcher, CNO Developer
Provided security solutions across Red and Blue Team Operations

work.name: SUN VALLEY HEALTH SERVICES
work.summary: Led IT strategy, achieving 4x revenue growth and successful acquisition.
highlights: Maintained HIPAA compliance with strong security measures
Implemented automated SMS and database integration for customer experience

work.name: Asimily
work.summary: Researched preventative solutions for malicious threats in medical devices.
highlights: Generated proprietary network rules for vulnerability incidents

work.name: Consultant
work.summary: Led research teams to assess products for private clients.
highlights: Developed cybersecurity assessments and solutions for client security
Managed cybersecurity testing and reporting for various applications

work.name: RiskIQ
work.summary: Implemented RiskIQ solutions for threat intelligence and customer support.
highlights: Developed workflows, documentation, and customer enablement
Delivered intelligence reports and researched emerging threats

awards.title: 1st Place Winner
awards.summary: Awarded for top performance in Dark Web Hackathon hosted by Peerlyst.

awards.title: Best Use of IBM BlueMix
awards.summary: Recognized for innovative application of IBM BlueMix in NASA's SpaceApps Challenge.

awards.title: Winner of NuCypher's Sponsored Hackathon
awards.summary: Secured victory at NuCypher-sponsored event for blockchain and crypto solutions.

publications.name: CryptoCurrencies: Are you in control of YOUR money?
publications.summary: Discusses the control and security aspects of cryptocurrency ownership and transactions.

publications.name: Bitcoins are Here to Stay: Here's Why
publications.summary: An overview of the staying power of Bitcoin and the technology behind it.

publications.name: Android Security Enhancements, Version by Version
publications.summary: Comprehensive overview of Android’s evolving security features, highlighting defense mechanisms against malware and exploits.

publications.name: Bypassing ASLR: Damn Heroes and Their Defenses
publications.summary: Examines techniques for bypassing Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) in memory address protection.

publications.name: Alter a String to Make It Un-Googleable
publications.summary: Techniques for creating search-resistant strings using unique character encodings.

publications.name: Rekalling the Times I Played with Windows
publications.summary: Guide on RAM forensics using Rekall and Volatility to capture and analyze memory for valuable forensic artifacts.

publications.name: Creating Yara Rules for Malware Detection
publications.summary: Guide on writing effective Yara rules for identifying and categorizing malware with advanced rule features.

publications.name: Injecting a Running Process in Linux
publications.summary: Exploration of Linux process injection techniques using ptrace and signals for in-depth control of process behavior.

publications.name: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
publications.summary: Introductory guide on CSRF attacks, with practical examples using Burp Suite and OWASP's Mutillidae II.

publications.name: Bypassing NX/DEP
publications.summary: Technical guide on bypassing memory protections like NX and DEP across major OS platforms.

publications.name: Rare Candy Hack: How and Why MissingNo is Triggered in Pokemon Red/Blue
publications.summary: Analysis of the infamous MissingNo glitch in Pokémon games, explaining its mechanics and impact on gameplay.
